items.subject: ~[CHAMP]~ NYMS pop-up walk, Long Pond Park, Staten Island, Sunday, December 7th
items.snippet: Plus... a SALE on T-Shirts; NAMA Fungus Film Fest; Fun With Fungi book event <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiZjYxY2FmNDM1ZD
items.skinnyBody: Plus... a SALE on T-Shirts; NAMA Fungus Film Fest; Fun With Fungi book event <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiZjYxY2FmNDM1ZDNjIixmYWxzZV0> Thursday December 4th, 2025 *NYMS pop-up walk, Long Pond Park, Staten Island, Sunday, December 7th* [image: Nidularia deformis; Long Pond Park; Feb 8, 2020; Tom Bigelow.] <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiMWEyMzQxNGJjODY1IixmYWxzZV0> *Nidularia deformis* <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiZmFlYjBjMmY1ODY5IixmYWxzZV0>; Long Pond Park; Feb 8, 2020; Tom Bigelow. Join us for a walk in *Long Pond Park, Staten Island* this * Sunday, December 7th*. Probably the only thing that would improve Long Pond Park would be moving it closer to the rest of New York City?that, and a concerted campaign to reduce the number of ticks and mosquitoes. The mosquitoes won't be out this Sunday. Ticks could be, though not in summer numbers. But other than that Long Pond is lovely. On Sunday's walk, be on the lookout for a very unusual bird's-nest fungus called *Nidularia deformis* <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiZmFlYjBjMmY1ODY5IixmYWxzZV0>, the Amorphous Bird's Nest. It has only ever been found in New York City twice?and once was in Long Pond Park. Bring paper bags for collecting specimens, a hand lens, a knife, a tackle box (optional), water and a lunch. The club is fairly all-weather, but if the forecast takes a particularly nasty turn, we will cancel this walk or shift it to another day. Please monitor your email in case we do. We highly recommend using the iNaturalist app (IOS <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiNTViNGEyMzYwMzAzIixmYWxzZV0> , Android <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiMTNlMDg1NTI4YjllIixmYWxzZV0>) to document the fungi you find. Find out how to use it here <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiMWRiNTI4ZmMxMTU3IixmYWxzZV0> . If you've never been on a mushroom walk with us before, here <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiN2NhODE0MGZiOTM5IixmYWxzZV0> is what to expect. *The walk* The walk starts at 11:00 AM. We will meet at the corner of Hylan Boulevard and Richard Avenue <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiMmJjODZkNjEyNzJiIixmYWxzZV0>. Once we have assembled we proceed down Richard Ave. to Barlow Ave. <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiOTkwODc5NGE0MGE5IixmYWxzZV0> where the walk begins. If you are coming from Manhattan you can get there via a combination of the SIM1C Express Bus and the S78 bus or a combination of the Staten Island Ferry and the S78 bus (95 stops!). Taking the SIR to Richmond Valley and walking 22 minutes is also an option. If you're coming from Brooklyn your best bet is to get there via Bay Ridge and a combination of the S79 and S78 buses. You might want to use the MTA trip planner <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiMTQ0MmNmMzVkYTRkIixmYWxzZV0> to find a transit route that works best for you. And definitely check the MTA Service Advisory web page <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiNWNiZjEzMmU2NDBhIixmYWxzZV0> for last-minute schedule changes. Please give yourself plenty of time to get there! Walk leader: Ethan Crenson: 347-268-5404 Assistant walk leader: Adrienne Perry: 206-910-5834 We look forward to seeing you at the walk! Full info here <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiMWEyMzQxNGJjODY1IixmYWxzZV0> *T-shirt sale...while supplies last* <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiNGU3MGQ2ZGNiOWU0IixmYWxzZV0> T-shirts make great gifts, they help fund NYMS programs, and they're stylish and impeccably designed. We are having a sale on our dwindling inventory of t-shirts. We have discounted all of the shirts still available in the *Merch section of this site* <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiNGU3MGQ2ZGNiOWU0IixmYWxzZV0>. 2025 Fungus Festival t-shirts are now $20 (marked down by $5). Historic New York Mushroom Club t-shirts are $15 (again, marked down by $5). Shipping is a flat $7.* It will also be possible to pick up your t-shirt purchases at upcoming walks.* Select "Walk Pickup (free)" at checkout and let us know what walk you'll be on to get the t-shirt. Shop the shirts <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiNGU3MGQ2ZGNiOWU0IixmYWxzZV0> *NON-NYMS EVENT* *NAMA's 2025 Fungi Film Fest Screening* [image: 2025 Fungi Film Fest] <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiZjgyNzg3ZWE2ZDM0IixmYWxzZV0> THIS IS A VIRTUAL EVENT! NAMA presents the 2025 Fungi Film Fest. Join us to see 14 short films from 8 countries with a total run-time of 120 minutes. The Fungi Film Fest is the world's only film festival dedicated to the beauty, weirdness, and human influences of mushrooms, lichens, and micro fungi. Films are submitted by people like you, with the only requirement for entry being that the film features fungi in some way. Each year brings a different mix of films. Learn more about the 2025 FILMS? <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiOWI3ZWQzMDdiZmQ3IixmYWxzZV0> The 2025 Film Fest is offered to all NAMA members for $5 per member. Special Offer: Join NAMA for $25 AND watch the Film Fest Get your tickets here <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiNzE4ZmZhYzAyMGE2IixmYWxzZV0> !? This event is ONLY available as a live event - no recordings will be made available. *Wednesday December 10th, 2025: 8 PM Eastern | 7 PM Central | 6 PM Mountain | 5 PM Pacific* Full info here <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiZjgyNzg3ZWE2ZDM0IixmYWxzZV0> *NON-NYMS EVENT* Check out our iNaturalist Project <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiNDk4NmQ3NTc1NDY0IixmYWxzZV0> Fungi NYC <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiZTQwYmNjM2E1M2ZjIixmYWxzZV0> Check out our iNaturalist Project <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiZGNjYWExYzE0ZDg2IixmYWxzZV0> Slime Molds of NYC <https://www.newyorkmyc.org?mailpoet_router&endpoint=track&action=click&data=WyIzNzIzIiwiYzE3NzVjIiwiMzMyIiwiZGNjYWExYzE0ZDg2IixmYWxzZV0> Check out our iNaturalist Project
